companyDescription:
Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, Ainsworth operates offices across Canada in most major cities and in both official languages. Ainsworth is one of Canada’s leading integrated multi-trade companies providing high-quality technical trades services, including HVAC, mechanical, electrical, data cabling, and building and industrial automation for institutional, commercial, and industrial clients across the country. As an integrated multi-trade company, we offer end-to-end services and solutions for all asset maintenance and refurbishment requirements of our customers.

Ainsworth is a wholly owned subsidiary of GDI Integrated Facility Services, a publicly traded company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX:GDI) and a leader and innovator in the industry. GDI is the fifth-largest facility services business in North America with more than 20,000 employees, servicing over 500 million square feet, and with operations across Canada and the United States.

The strength of Ainsworth and the GDI family is unparalleled in the marketplace for delivery of value-added facility services across all our clients’ needs.

Since 1933, Ainsworth has been a significant and growing force in the maintenance renovation service industries of Canada. Our maintenance and retrofit services have allowed us to build and develop relationships with customers, from the project installation stage to ongoing maintenance, service operations, and life-cycle replacement.

Our commitment to quality and our ISO 9001 certification are an essential part of our core values, guiding our actions to deliver products and services that are safe, compliant, and preferred by our customers. We believe it is essential to deliver quality-of-service in everything we do in order to be recognized as our customers’ trusted advisor across all technical trades.
description:
If you thrive in a team-oriented workplace that challenges your skills, to drive your career development, embraces diversity, and rewards innovation, with competitive pay and great employee programs, join the Ainsworth (a GDI company) team today!
Position Summary:
The HVAC Working Foreperson will report directly to the Regional Operations Manager and will support a team of Service Technicians within the Ontario Region. The specific responsibilities of the position will encompass each of the following KPI's.
Responsibilities:

 Establish and maintain professional customer relations.
 Provide equipment service, maintenance and repairs for existing customer base.
 Assist in solving equipment problems and development/implementation of solutions to prevent future occurrence.
 Recommend ways to reduce costs and eliminate unnecessary expenses.
 Provide technical assistance, training, development, motivation and leadership to the team.
 Assist Operations Manager with; Project planning, scheduling and prioritizing of contracts and extra work with follow up to ensure service is provided in a timely manner.
 Special projects and field recommendations.
 Recruitment and performance management.
 Plan and participation in staff meetings.
 Ensure Environmental Health and Safety Policies are adhered to, safe work procedures and participate in weekly HS&S talks.
 Conduct Monthly vehicle inspections.
 With the support of the Service Coordinator Manager, manage and dispatch service technicians to the service call requirements.
 Visit on a regular basis different service sites, meet the customers to ensure quality of delivery while furthering the relationship.
 Assist and review quotes with Quotation Department.
 Support Sales team to develop quotes for service and project related work.
 Down time to be approved by Regional Supervisor.
 Wages as per the collective agreement (Foreman’s rate).
 All other duties as required.

Qualifications:

 10 years previous experience as a certified Journeyperson or HVAR related experience and hold a current refrigeration license and ODP card. Any additional Licenses would be considered an asset. ie OBT1 or 2, 309A Electrician...
 Must hold Gas Fitter 1 certificate and have sound working knowledge of HVAC system design and building maintenance.
 Strong training and presentation skills.
 Excellent time management, planning and organization skills.
 A good understanding of Ainsworth products and services

Why work at Ainsworth?
Ainsworth, a subsidiary of GDI, company is growing at an unprecedented rate and to help attract and retain top talent, we provide benefits on your first day with us. We offer a wide variety of benefits including the following:
Benefits: Comprehensive health, dental and medical benefits, including wellness supports, RRSP matching and generous vacation
Rewards: Service milestones and peer recognition plus Employee Discounts and Incentives
Flexibility: Hybrid working models, where applicable
Diversity: An inclusive organization that embraces diversity and belonging; work in a great team atmosphere with future potential for promotion within company.
If you are a dynamic and results-oriented professional with a passion to lead a talented and driven group, we invite you to apply. Join our team and contribute to the success of Ainsworth Inc. as we continue to provide innovative solutions to our clients.Ainsworth, a subsidiary of GDI, is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status as per our Accommodation Policy, available upon request.
While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.
Ainsworth, a subsidiary of GDI, is an integrated multi-trade company, offering an end-to-end services and solutions for all asset maintenance and refurbishment requirements of our customers. We are continually striving to create better and more advanced products as well as provide the highest quality service. We are rapidly growing and need talented professionals to help drive our vision at becoming the best multi-trade company in the country! Join us…. Make a difference.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Extended health care
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision care

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Licence/Certification:

 Gas Fitter 1 certificate (required)
 refrigeration license and ODP card (required)

Ability to Commute:

 Ottawa, ON K2E 7Z2 (required)

Work Location: In person
